trans-unit.source: Extends design-time behavior for the <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.CreateUserWizard"></xref> Web server control.
Extend the CreateUserWizardDesigner class if you want to create a designer for a class that extends the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.CreateUserWizard> Web server control.
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.Web.UI.Design.WebControls.CreateUserWizardDesigner"></xref> class.
Gets the <xref href="System.ComponentModel.Design.DesignerActionListCollection"></xref> object for this designer.
The <xref href="System.ComponentModel.Design.DesignerActionListCollection"></xref> associated with this designer.

Creates a <xref href="System.Web.UI.Design.DesignerRegion"></xref> object for each step associated with the underlying wizard control, and then adds it to the specified <xref href="System.Web.UI.Design.DesignerRegionCollection"></xref> object.
The <xref href="System.Web.UI.Design.DesignerRegionCollection"></xref> to which regions associated with the wizard control are added.
Gets the <xref href="System.Web.UI.Design.DesignerAutoFormatCollection"></xref> object associated with this designer.
The <xref href="System.Web.UI.Design.DesignerAutoFormatCollection"></xref> associated with this designer.
Converts the child controls associated with the underlying wizard control to a custom navigation template.
Gets the HTML that provides information about the specified exception.
This method is typically called after an error has been encountered at design time.
The exception that occurred.
The HTML for the specified exception.
Initializes the designer and loads the specified component.
The control element being designed.
Exposes the properties associated with each default step through the property grid on the designer tool.
The PreFilterProperties method provides a way to add items to the dictionary of properties that a designer exposes.
The keys in the dictionary of properties are the names of the properties.
The objects are of type <xref:System.ComponentModel.PropertyDescriptor>.
The <xref href="System.ComponentModel.PropertyDescriptor"></xref> objects that represent the properties of the component's base class.
The keys in the dictionary of properties are property names.

Gets a value indicating whether the designer uses the <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.CreateUserWizard"></xref> control itself to generate the design-time HTML or uses a temporarily created copy.

When the value of the UsePreviewControl property is `true`, the designer uses a temporary copy of the wizard control to generate the design-time HTML; when the value of UsePreviewControl is `false`, the designer uses the wizard control itself to generate the design-time HTML.
The value of UsePreviewControl modifies the return value of the designer's <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.ControlDesigner.ViewControl%2A> property.
When UsePreviewControl is `true`, <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.ControlDesigner.ViewControl%2A> returns a copy of the wizard control.
When UsePreviewControl is `false`, <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.ControlDesigner.ViewControl%2A> returns the wizard control itself.

If the wizard control is marked with a class-level <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.SupportsPreviewControlAttribute> attribute, the <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.SupportsPreviewControlAttribute> is ignored, because the value of UsePreviewControl is always `true`.
Always<xref uid="langword_csharp_ true" name=" true" href=""></xref>.
